column4: Uh, why wont dpkg-reconfigure replace deleted configuration files?
why would you expect it to?
in any case, can you be more specific?
i deleted the configuration files for libsensors3 and 4. i was kinda hoping a program with that name would replace configuration files...
init=/bin/bash works. sometines sh being a symlink will fail...
I'm pretty sure it just runs the .config and .postinst files for a package (or similar).  Just purge your package and reinstall it
there REALLY needs to be a purge-reinstall option...
how can i forcefully purge the packages without removing other packages?
have you tried just reinstalling?
-without removing other packages-
you can use dpkg to force things like that
ooh, dark dpkg magic...
dpkg --install --force-confmiss PACKAGE.deb   may be what you want.  You can probably pass similar flags to apt-get
the mighty google tells me: apt-get -o DPkg::Options::="--force-confmiss" --reinstall install <packagename>
what file specifically are you trying to get back?
sensors.conf and sensors3.conf
dpkg -S /etc/sensors.conf
dpkg: /etc/sensors.conf not found.
so no package owns that file
uh, dpkg-reconfigure says "not replacing deleted configuration file /etc/sensors.conf"
it must be owned by some package :o
why not read https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SensorInstallHowto
good luck (i must go)
